description.p: A human in tattered clothes delivers a flurry of punches to a thug in a dark alley. A half-orc with scarred fists grapples a foe to the ground, striking with ruthless precision. An elf in loose wraps dances around her opponent, landing devastating kicks. These are Street Fighters, warriors forged in the crucible of urban brawls and underground cages. Masters of unarmed combat, they wield their bodies as weapons, blending raw power, cunning, and instinct. Whether a disciplined boxer, a scrappy street dog, a fluid Muay Thai artist, a brutal MMA-inspired hound, or a savage beast, Street Fighters thrive in chaos, facing danger with grit and skill.

Street Fighters excel in close-quarters combat, using fists, kicks, elbows, and improvised weapons. They are not bound by formal training but by hard-earned experience in unpredictable environments. Each Street Fighter specializes in a unique style, from stunning punches to tactical improvisation, making them versatile in any brawl.

Not every street thug or tavern brawler is a Street Fighter. Only those who have endured countless fights, honed their instincts, and mastered their craft rise to this level. They might be pit fighters, gang enforcers, or self-taught survivors, but all share a knack for turning any situation to their advantage.

Consider your character’s origins: Where did you learn to fight? In a boxing ring, a back alley, or an underground cage? What drives you—revenge, survival, or glory? Were you mentored by a grizzled veteran, or did you claw your way up through sheer will? Your scars, tattoos, or fighting stance might reflect your past, shaping how you approach combat and the world.

Make Strength or Dexterity your highest ability score, depending on whether you focus on powerful strikes or agile maneuvers. Constitution should be your next-highest score for durability. Choose the Urchin or Criminal background.
As a Street Fighter, you get the following class features.

Hit Dice: 1d10 per gunslinger level
Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per gunslinger level after 1st

Armor: Light armor
Weapons: Simple weapons, improvised weapons

Saving Throws: Strength, Constitution
Skills: Choose two from Acrobatics, Athletics, Insight, Intimidation, Perception, Stealth, and Survival
You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a set of common clothes or (b) padded armor
(a) a shortsword, (b) two daggers or (c) nothing
(a) a sling with 20 stones or (b) 10 throwing knives (use dagger stats)
(a) a burglar’s pack or (b) an explorer's pack

description.p: At 1st level, your practice of iron fists gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons, which are shortswords and any simple melee weapons that don’t have the two-handed or heavy property.
You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only monk weapons and you aren’t wearing armor or wielding a shield:

ul.li: You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes
You can roll a d6 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike. This die changes as you gain Street Fighter levels, as shown in the Iron Fists column of the Street Fighter table.

sheet.description: Your unarmed strike does 1d{{iron fists:dice}}+{{iron fists:damage}} damage. You can use Strength or Dexterity for these attacks.

description.p: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier.

sheet.description: While you aren’t wearing armor, your AC equals {{ac:tough skin street fighter}}.
